definitions.definition: ( transitive , obsolete ) To fool or trick (someone).
( intransitive , British , dialectal , informal ) To engage in frivolous behavior ; to fool around or waste time .

main_definition: ( transitive , obsolete ) To fool or trick (someone).
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , British , dialectal , informal ) To engage in frivolous behavior ; to fool around or waste time .

definitions.definition: ( ambitransitive , Shetland , singing ) To hum or sing (a tune ) at a low pitch or volume .

main_definition: ( ambitransitive , Shetland , singing ) To hum or sing (a tune ) at a low pitch or volume .

subdefinitions.definition: ( chiefly jazz ) To play (a musical instrument or passage of music ) or to sing (a passage of music) in an improvisatory or lighthearted manner ; also, to play (a series of ornamental notes ) on an instrument.
( US , informal ) To ponder or think about (something).
examples: “ Noodle that thought around for a while,” said Dr. Johnson to his Biblical Interpretations class.

subdefinitions.definition: ( chiefly jazz ) To play a musical instrument or to sing in an improvisatory or lighthearted manner; also, to play a series of ornamental notes on an instrument.
examples: He has been noodling with that trumpet all afternoon, and every bit of it sounds awful.

subdefinitions.definition: ( US , informal ) To ponder or think, especially in an unproductive or unsystematic manner; to muse . To attempt in an informal or uncertain manner; to fiddle . Often followed by about or around : to mess around , to play .
examples: He noodled over the problem for a day or two before making a decision.
If the machine is really broken, noodling with the knobs is not going to fix it.

subdefinitions.definition: To search ( mullock ( “ mining or ore processing waste ” ) ) for opals .
To obtain (an opal) by searching through mullock.
( also figuratively ) To clear extraneous material from (an opal).

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To search mullock for opals; to fossick .

secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To search mullock for opals; to fossick .

definitions.definition: To catch ( fish (usually very large catfish ), turtles , or other aquatic animals ) with the hands ; also, to catch (fish) using a gaff or fishing spear ; to gaff .
examples: Fred had several lacerations on his hands from noodling flathead in the river.

main_definition: ( transitive , fishing ) To catch ( fish (usually very large catfish ), turtles , or other aquatic animals ) with the hands ; also, to catch (fish) using a gaff or fishing spear ; to gaff .
